m_szDocTitle: Wall Street begins year sharply lower after China selloff  | Reuters
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- Markets | Mon Jan 4, 2016 7:05pm EST Wall Street begins year sharply lower after China selloff By Caroline Valetkevitch U.S. stocks began 2016 sharply lower on Monday, with the Dow marking its worst start to a year since 2008, after weak Chinese economic data fanned fears of a global slowdown. Indexes partly recovered late in the session, following a turnaround in oil prices that caused energy shares to cut losses.
